page.title: 18CAVING ON THE MENDIPS
page.content: Caving in the Mendips started seriously about eighty years ago. There are not many caves in the area of this map but there are many on the Mendips, for example around Wookey, Cheddar and Priddy. The few caves in this particular area are Attborough Swallet 561,519. Mine 4118 573,529. Mine 4117 573,539. Willets Lane Hole 588,529. Nedge Hole 529,508. Lily Combe Hole 582,536. Greendown Farm Mine Shaft 574,538. Cavers may also wish to visit many other caves in the Wookey, Priddy and Cheddar areas. Further information and a cave rescue service can be found at Wells Hill Bottom on the B3135 1 kilometre east of Green Ore.
